results.title: A Changing view of the change of life
results.creator_credit: Hy Kalus, Walter Lowendahl and Dynamic Productions
results.brief_description: Many questions relating to menopause are answered in this candid and informative film for women of all ages, and their families. Modern medical research has made startling discoveries about this period in a woman’s life and these have altered the traditional concepts about menopause. The film presents new attitudes and shows how doctors are dealing with the physical and emotional problems.

results.title: A Changing Perspective
results.brief_description: This film covers the widening interests of the Australian Paper Mills company. An historical background is given and the present main interests of the company, forestry, paper and pulp are documented. New projects include a diverse range of activities such as paper, plastic and metal packaging

results.title: A Changing culture
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Rainbow serpent”.
David Gulpilil has become a success in the white man’s world, through his acting ability and leadership of a dance troupe. Yet he prefers to live in a traditional manner with his people in Arnhem Land, making brief forays into western society in order to publicise their plight and demonstrate the richness of their culture. Charmaine Green is a linguist student at the Australian National University. When she visits her family in Mullewa, W.A. and observes the hopeless life they lead on the fringes of western society, she feels that she cannot return there permanently, although she is determined not to deny her Aboriginality in spite of her light skin.

results.title: A Change of Pace
results.brief_description:
A film about the 1983 Australian Lawn Bowls Championship in Adelaide between Jeff Bradley and Jack Christey. Follows the lives of the players both at home and on the greens in the lead-up to the match.

The film begins and concludes with a promotion of the retirement services offered by the ANZ Bank.

results.title: A Chance to travel
results.creator_credit: George Snowden, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When George Snowden joined the Australian army, he was given the opportunity to tour Australia. Despite being given the chance to travel across the country, Snowden ended up suffering from a knee injury and was happy to return home after seeing most of the country.

results.title: A Chance to save a life
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the mouth-to-mouth resuscitation technique and points out how lives may be saved by prompt action in common accidents. Please note that some of this information is out of date (1998).

results.title: A Chance to learn
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore, British Productivity Council and Basic Films
results.brief_description: The advantages gained by industry from a systematic training of operators. A middle-aged woman, discontented because the personnel officer regards training as an expensive gimmick, takes another job where, given the chance to learn, her whole attitude changes. A small garment factory adopts a training program which becomes an indispensable part of normal activities.

results.creator_credit: Michael Craven, UNICEF and Thomas Craven Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows how breast feeding, growth charts, oral rehydration therapy and immunization are successful in lowering child mortality and provide millions of children with an improved quality of life.

results.title: A Chance decision
results.creator_credit: Graham Goulding, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A chance decision led Graham Goulding into a teaching job in China where the banquets were endless and he and his colleagues were treated like royalty. A unique adventure that has remained with Goulding long after his return to Gippsland.

results.title: A Chance Affair
results.brief_description: Chance makes a declaration to his best mate Jeff only to realise that what he thought was there can disappear just like smoke. Meanwhile, club diva Aviante sends a message to all the little wannabes out there who try and sing Whitney’s signature songs.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.description: Chance makes a declaration to his best mate Jeff only to realise that what he thought was there can disappear just like smoke. Meanwhile, club diva Aviante sends a message to all the little wannabes out there who try and sing Whitney’s signature songs.
